task_summary: Pick up the red block from the table using a robot arm, as specified by the instruction and confirmed by the contact sheet visuals.

task_long_description.overview: This episode tasks a robot arm with picking up a red block that is placed on a table, surrounded by blue markers. The scene is strictly grounded in the contact sheet, which tracks the robot approaching, grasping, and lifting the block. The robot must localize the red block, position itself above it, open its gripper, compute a suitable top-down grasp pose, approach with precision, execute the grasp, verify success, and then retreat. No placement is required; constraints focus on accuracy of pick and avoidance of collisions.
preconditions: Red block is present and not occluded on table
Robot gripper is operational and starts open
No obstacles obstructing approach or retreat
stepwise_plan: Move above block to pregrasp position
Compute grasp pose for top approach
Align and approach block with high precision
success_criteria: Red block securely held by gripper
Block lifted clear of table without incident
Robot arm does not disturb other objects
failure_and_recovery: Grasp fails: reacquire and retry align and grasp
Unstable grasp: release and repeat approach
task_long_description.termination: Task ends upon successful block pickup and retreat or after repeated failure attempts.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if the red block is visible to sensors
Scans the workspace for the red block using a grid pattern
Performs focused detection on the red block
Opens the gripper to 8cm width in preparation for grasping
Moves the end-effector to a position above the red block
Computes a top-down grasp pose for the block
Aligns the gripper to the computed grasp pose with precision
Grasps the red block at the computed pose
Checks if the block is currently held by the gripper
Lifts the held block and retreats from the table area

failure_modes: Block not detected due to occlusion or lighting
Grasp fails: slip or insufficient grip
recovery_strategy: Retry scan and detection up to set attempts
Recompute alignment and repeat grasp if detection fails
Abort or retreat on collision; log and alert operator
assumptions: Visual frames confirm only pickup, no placement needed
Instruction specifies 'red object', frames reveal a red block; identifier renamed
No specific force or speed implied; default bin values used
No container or occlusion events in frames

expected_success_criteria: Block held securely and lifted clear of table
